Dating: 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not before); TAHARQA/KHUNEFERTEMRE ?; 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not after)
Name: Altar
Description: This object in sandstone is the upper part of a model of an altar. It has been discovered in the temple of Taharqa at Kawa. The model is composed of a square socle on which is found a bowl framed by four horns. It probably served as a censer.
